alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb; Floyd; Haralson; Paulding; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 9:05PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Paulding, southwestern Cherokee, northern Haralson, northwestern Cobb, southern Floyd, Polk and southern Bartow Counties through 930 PM EST... At 904 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Cave Spring to near Esom Hill to near Coleman Lake And Campground, and moving east at 75 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Canton, Cartersville, Dallas, Cedartown, Kennesaw, Acworth, Holly Springs, Rockmart, Euharlee, Hiram, Emerson, Aragon, Cave Spring, Braswell, Taylorsville, Yorkville, Burnt Hickory Ridge, Kellogg Creek, Red Top Mountain State Park and Cross Roads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
